column1: shortDescription: "By spending countless hours fiddling with scrap parts
column2: tinkerers can create wondrous items.Some tinkerers enhance their items with arcane magic."
never go throwin’ crap away when it might serve a purpose.Hoarding is good for the soul
column3: you see. You know what they say about one person’s trash. ‘Give it to the tinkerer
column5: hand it over and I’ll make you a can opener.Or a flamethrower
column6: mayhap."

column1: longDescription: "You have never been able to keep from fidgeting
column5: and the like as you seek to create new inventions or improve upon existing ones. You always had a penchant for tinkering and exhibit relentless ingenuity. You quickly gained notoriety as someone who could always find a way to enhance anything with mechanical parts.Unquenchably curious
column6: you always seek to understand how something works and how it might be improved upon. What is your medium of choice? Tinkerers often favor metal and wood due to their versatility
column7: but other substances can make for interesting inventions as well.When you invent something
column8: what motivates you? Are you most concerned with improving your quality of life by making existing technology more effective
column9: or are you looking to break the confines of science as your contemporaries understand it? Do you have some grand idea for a new invention that will revolutionize the world?"

column6: "When you take this entry talent
column7: you gain the following abilities."

column4: You gain a set of Tinker’s Tools.

You specify a weapon or set of armor as your focus. You can change your focus by spending at least a day tinkering with your new focus. Your currently focused item gains +1 to hit and damage if a weapon, and +1 to AR if armor. These bonuses are in addition to any enhancements, enchantments, or other bonuses to that weapon or armor’s statistics. If you change your Masterwork focus, your old focus loses the improvements from this talent.

You can very quickly cobble together an improvised set of tools, a simple item (like a crowbar or pulley), which lasts for a single use. Alternatively, you can patch a simple broken item (such as a rowboat with a hole, or a busted door drawbar), which lasts for 1 hour. (1/Rest)

column6: Each time you Take a Rest, you make two Alchemy Creations. Your first option for Alchemy Creations is Alchemy Flasks.

column4: "Create an Alchemy Flask. Choose a spell from the Formula list
column5: and that spell is synthesized. When a creature drinks the potion
column6: that creature gains the effects of the spell for the duration
column7: considering the spell’s range to be “Self.” These creations become impotent after 24 hours."

column6: "Add Healing Vials to your possible creations. When creating Healing Vials in this way
column7: you do not need to spend the material components
column8: but they expire after 24 hours."

column6: "Add Alchemy Bombs to your possible creations."

column4: "Spend 2 AP to throw an alchemy bomb
column5: which has a thrown range of 20 ft. Make a DEX vs REF attack roll
column6: dealing
column7: 2d6 fire damage to all creatures within a 5 ft radius of the bomb’s point of contact
column8: and ½ damage on a miss."

column6: "Once on each of your turns
column7: you may drink a potion without spending AP."

column6: "When you throw a bomb
column7: you can now specify a number of targets equal to or less than your INT. Those creatures take no damage from your bombs."

column6: "You can now make four Alchemy Creations when you Take a Rest."
"Your Healing Vials become Healing Potions."
"Your flask is designed for quick combat consumption. Using an Alchemist Flask no longer triggers the Exploit maneuver or other reactive actions."

column4: Tinkerer, Alchemist, Alchemy II, Create Bomb
column6: "Your bombs deal additional damage equal to your INT."
"You can administer Potions or Flasks for 1 AP."

column4: Tinkerer, Alchemist, Alchemy II, Create Bomb
column6: "You can create bombs that deal cold or corrosive damage instead of fire
column7: choosing the type of damage when you create the bomb."

column4: Tinkerer, Alchemist, Alchemy II, Create Bomb
column6: "If none of your creations for the day are bombs
column7: you gain one Alchemy Bomb."

column6: "You can create Vitality Solutions
column7: which grant 3d4+INT Shield HP upon consumption."

column6: "You can now create six alchemy creations when you Take a Rest."

column4: Tinkerer, Alchemist, Alchemy III, Create Bomb
column6: "Your bombs now target creatures in a 10 ft radius from the bomb’s point of contact."
"When one of your flasks is used
column7: the creature that uses it rolls a 1d6. On a 6
column8: the flask is not consumed. Once this feature is used successfully
column9: you lose this ability until after you Take a Rest."

column6: "You can administer Potions or Flasks for 1 AP."
"You can now administer Potions or Flasks at a range of 20 ft by spending 3 AP."
"Brewers
column7: poisoners
column8: and potion-makers all respect you as a master of the craft. Many would gladly pay you handsomely to teach them the secrets of your skills. You can make a number of Alchemy Creations equal to  your INT
column9: and your creations remain potent for 48 hours. You no longer lose your Flask Efficiency ability after it issuccessful."

column4: "Your Flask Efficiency ability is successful on a roll of 4-6."

column1: description: "Through unstable experiments you have accessed the arcane source of magic and can fuel spells with your inventions."

column2: "You specialize in creating powerful armor that implements weapons
column5: turning you into a tremendous front- line fighter."

column7: "You gain the Armor Augmentation ability. This replaces your Masterwork ability."

column4: Choose a set of armor that will become your Augmented Armor. It encases your entire body and grants you +1 to all defenses in addition to its base stats. You are treated as one Size category larger than you would normally be for the purposes of lifting, carrying, dragging, and grappling. You can change your Augmented Armor after Taking a Rest and spending 2 additional hours disassembling your old Augmented Armor.

column6: "You may install a weapon into your armor
column7: losing the ability to be disarmed of that weapon."

column6: "You may install a shield onto one of your arms. You can spend 1 AP to activate the shield and 1 AP to lower the shield. When it is lowered
column7: you can wield a weapon with that hand. When it is activated
column8: you can manipulate and carry objects
column9: but cannot make attacks with that arm. "

column6: "You gain a compartment on one of your Augmented Armor’s forearms or thighs that fits 1 ft 3 of materials. You can spend 1 AP to stow items in it. Someone breaking into the compartment must make a DC 20 AWR check to find the compartment and a DC 20 STR/Applied Force or INT/ Lockpicking check to open it."
"You double the range of your thrown items."
"If you have Line of Effect
column7: you can spend 3 AP to fire a free hand at a creature within 15 ft of you
column8: attacking their REFwith your STR or DEX. If it hits and the target is your Size or lower
column9: you can pull the target to you as part of the same attack. If it is larger
column10: you can pull yourself to it as part of the same attack."

column6: "You can spend 1 AP to gain +10 ft to your speed until the end of your turn."
"You can spend 1 Reactive AP to reduce elemental damage by 1d6. You can unleash this on your next attack
column7: dealing additional damage equal to the amount of damage this feature absorbed."

column6: "If you suffer a crit
column7: you take damage as usual
column8: then you gain Resist X against the type of damage you took until the start of your next turn
column9: where X = your INT"

column6: "You gain the Engage ability"

column4: By spending 2 AP, you can impose the Engaged condition on a creature within 5 ft of you. This lasts until the start of your next turn.

column6: "Your Augmented Armor gains +1 to all defenses and your choice of Resist 2 against blunt
column7: cold
column8: fire
column9: lightning

column6: "You may spend 2 AP to become immune to sonic damage and effects that require you to hear until the beginning of your next turn."
"Your Grappler attack gains +10 ft range
column7: and if you hit
column8: the target is immediately Grappled."

column6: "You can now enhance your Engage ability
column7: engaging one additional target within 5 ft of you for each additional 1 AP you spend on the ability."

column6: "Your quick compartment may now store liquid
column7: and can be climate controlled between 50 and 120 ° F (Named for Doctor Franklin Fahrenheit
column8: who discovered the Coldstone and Fireflecks used in this invention)."

column7: "By spending 1 hour working on your armor
column8: you can install an automated crossbow turret on your shoulder. This crossbow has a 60 ft range and deals 1d4 sharp damage on a hit. When you specify
column9: it fires at a target you can see with Line of Effect at the end of each of your turns while you have ammunition."

column6: "You can install a second weapon into your armor. Gain the ability to freely switch between weapons."

column7: "You gain the Power Slam ability."

column4: You may spend 4 AP to slam a weapon into the ground, attacking all creatures within 5 ft of you. Make a weapon attack vs the FORT of each creature in range. On a hit, creatures take damage from the weapon as usual and are also pushed 5 ft directly away from you.

column7: "Spend 1 AP or 1 Reactive AP to gain the ability to Hover for 1 minute. You can choose to slowly descend during the duration. (3/Rest)"

column6: "Your Augmented Armor gains +1 to all defenses and your choice of Resist 2 against blunt
column7: cold
column8: fire
column9: lightning

column7: "You may spend 3 AP to transfer all conditions from a creature you are grappling to yourself
column8: except for Grappled and Restrained."

column4: Tinkerer, Augmentor, Augmentor III, Arcane Booster
column6: "You gain a Fly Speed equal to your speed for 1 minute. (3/ Rest)"
"You no longer take falling damage when falling less than 30 ft. If you fall at least 20 ft
column7: you can attack all creatures within a 10 ft radius of where you land with your STR or DEX vs their REF. If you hit
column8: they take 1d8 blunt damage and are knocked Prone."

column6: "You may cover an ally in your Augmented Armor once per round. Choose an ally within 5 ft of you who is being attacked by an attacker you can see. You can take the damage in their place by spending 1 Reactive AP. Regain the ability to do this at the beginning of your next turn. The triggering attack automatically hits you."

column4: Tinkerer, Augmentor, Augmentor III, Cradle, Grappler
column6: "You may now use your Grappler to pull an ally to you. When an ally within reach of your Grappler ability would take damage
column7: you may spend 1 Reactive AP to pull them to an unoccupied space within 5 ft of you and take the damage for them."

column6: "Your augmented armor has become an extension of your person. You have perfected it and know every nook and cranny
column7: every quirk and crack. Gain +1 to all of your defenses. Crits no longer automatically hit you
column8: and if they do hit
column9: they only deal normal damage."

column4: When a creature attacks you, you may spend 2 Reactive AP to lower one of your defenses by X, increasing another one of your defenses by X. Your defenses remain altered in this way until the start of your next turn. (3/Recoup)

column6: "You can make a variety of unique nonmagical items assuming you have the time and materials. You learn how to make five items from the Tinkering Item List
column7: and can carry up to five items of this nature at a time. Special Arrows & Bolts do not count toward this total. Only you may use items that you create from the Tinkering Item list. For every 2 hours you spend tinkering
column8: make an INT check using a Crafting skill with your Tinker’s Tools
column9: and note the results. Tinkering checks are cumulative. For example
column10: if you roll a 11 on day 1
column12: that is considered 30. If you have access to a workshop
column13: the Tinkering Check total required is halved. Your first 2 hours of tinkering a day can be a part of Taking a Rest. See the Tinkering Item List for a list of items
column14: and note that your MC may allow additional items!"

column7: "You can break down nonmagical items for materials and use them for other items or their currency cost whenever you spend time tinkering. Most items can be broken down as a part of the time you spend tinkering on other inventions. A particularly complex or large item may have a tinkering cost
column8: determined by your MC. If you are breaking down items for currency
column9: you can find someone to purchase the materials for 80% of the item’s value
column10: regardless of the item’s state of repair
column11: anywhere there is trade of raw materials. Salvaged items are unrecognizable
column12: which means you can sell them even if the item itself may have baggage that would make it undesirable
column13: such as being believed to be haunted or stolen. If you salvage items to use for Tinkering parts
column14: take the sc value of the item you are salvaging
column15: and reduce your Tinkering check requirement for whatever you’re crafting by that amount. "

column7: "Every time you take a level in the Inventor track
column8: gain +2 in a Crafting skill of your choice. This works retroactively
column9: granting you +2 for all Inventor track talents you have already taken."

column7: "Exhaustible items with more than 1 use take half the Tinkering to create after you’ve created them once."
"Whenever you craft a single-use item
column8: you can create a second item of the same type by adding +10 to the Tinkering requirement of the first item."

column7: "You learn two new blueprints from the Tinkering Item List."
"You can carry five additional tinkering items."
"You can now add +20 to the Tinkering required in order to craft Tinkering items that others can use."

column6: "Choose a magical item
column7: weapon
column8: or piece of armor that you possess and that requires 25 or fewer Essence Points and Salvage it. You learn how to add that item’s abilities
column9: or “Enchantments” for the purpose of the abilities in the Tinkering track
column10: to your Masterwork. You can add or change enchantments to your Masterwork by spending 2 hours Tinkering with it. A single magical item
column12: or armor piece counts as one Enchantment
column13: even if it has multiple abilities. You can know a number of Enchantments equal to your INT
column14: and can have 2 Enchantments active on your Masterwork at one time. You must also observe the typical rules for Essence Points (Chapter 6
column16: your Masterwork uses only half the Essence Points you have imbued onto it through Masterwork Enchantments. For example
column17: if you have three Enchantments with 80 total Essence Points
column18: your Masterwork uses 40 of your Essence Points. Weapons can be improved with Item or Weapon Enchantments. Armor can be improved with Item or Armor enchantments or improvements. Items can be improved only with Item enchantments or improvements. If you change your Masterwork
column19: it loses this improvement until you add it to your Masterwork again."

column6: "You can now make a Tinker’s Tools check every hour
column7: instead of every 2 hours. "

column6: "Whenever you use your Tinkering to create ammunition
column7: if you have fewer than 20 special arrows or bolts
column8: you can now create your first 20 arrows or bolts in the time it would take you to make one. Special Arrows or Bolts beyond 20 take the normal Tinkering. Additionally
column9: you can make up to 40 mundane arrows or bolts without any chance of failure and minimal components (including broken bolts or arrows) by spending at least 1 hour tinkering."

column6: "If your Masterwork is Armor
column7: it gains an additional +1 to all physical defenses."

column6: "Your armor sprays cost half the Tinkering (minimum 10)."
"If your Masterwork is a Weapon
column7: it gains an additional +1 to hit and +1 to damage"

column6: "The Essence point cap for Masterwork Enchantment increases to 33."

column4: Tinkerer, Inventor, Soul of the Masterwork
column6: "The Essence point cap for Masterwork Enchantment increases to 50."
"You can now learn three Enchantments from salvaging magical items. If you would learn beyond your limit
column7: you can choose which one to forget
column8: but your Masterwork would lose that enchantment. Your Masterwork can now have a number of enchantments active at one time equal to 1/2 your INT. Changing enchantments on your Masterwork only takes 1 hour of Tinkering.These enchantments cannot stack if they are exactly the same.For example if you salvage two items that give + 1 to hit
column9: you can only enchant your Masterwork with +1 to hit once.But if you then salvage an item that gives + 1 to hit and + 1d6 fire damage
column10: you can enchant your Masterwork with +2 to hit and 1d6 extra fire damage."

column6: "You can learn an additional Masterwork Enchantment"
"You can change your Masterwork Enchantment configuration as a part of a Recoup."
"If your Masterwork is armor
column7: it gains an additional +1 to all physical and mental defenses."

column6: "Choose an exhaustible Tinkering item with more than one use. You now recharge that item on Taking a Rest without a required Tinkering check."
"If your Masterwork is a weapon
column7: mods installed on your Masterwork no longer count towards your limit of carried Tinkering items."

column6: "You are a renowned inventor and tinkerer whose creations are the subject of song and gossip. Many young minds seek to enter apprenticeship with you and the leading minds in engineering and education hold you in utmost regard. Your Masterwork is now a creation of some renown. It can now hold three Masterwork Enchantments. If it is a weapon
column7: it gains a bonus to damage rolls equal to ½ your INT."

column4: The final cap on your INT increases from 12 to 14.

column6: "You gain the Student of the Arcane talent if you do not already have it. Each time you level up and spend your talent point on a talent in the Magitechnician stack
column7: you gain +5 SP and +1 Arcane Power. Magitechnicians cast spells as if they were devices
column8: and the caster can choose how they describe the spells being cast. Perhaps a Fireball is launched from a firearm-like device
column9: Fly might be a jetpack
column10: Raise Skeleton could be a mechanical backpack puppeteering bones
column11: and Living Letter might be a tiny drone. This has no mechanical effect other than when you trigger Backlash as a Magitechnician. In this case
column12: you do not take damage or end your turn
column13: but you lose access to the spell that triggered Backlash until you Take a Rest
column14: as the contraption needs to be repaired. INT is your magic attribute."

column6: "You gain the Create Lesser Golem spell if you do not already know it. If you do not have a Lesser Golem active
column7: casting this spell is free for you and the created golem is permanent.It can be made of Metal or Stone as its Primary Material
column8: and it gains +2 STR. It is created by the Arcane Source. It gains the Mend and Minor Conjuration cantrips."

column6: "You create an object - such as a bracelet
column7: locket
column8: or ring
column9: that stores spells for you. When creating a mote via Delay Spell
column10: you can put the spell into the Spell Storing object and its duration becomes 24 hours. Your motes cannot be released prematurely without the condition being triggered
column11: and after the duration they dissipate harmlessly."

column6: "You are particularly skilled with the Mend cantrip. You now need only 80% of the pieces or components present for Mend to work
column7: and you can increase the casting time to gain the equivalent of more Arcane Power. When casting Mend
column8: act as though you have 1 additional Arcane Power for every additional 30 minutes you spend casting."

column6: "When you finish Taking a Rest
column7: you can prepare three spells as if they were devices. Roll 1d20 per spell to determine your spell’s bonus
column8: and then spend the required SP to cast the spell to prepare the Spell Devices.The first time you cast a spell prepared in this way
column9: it costs 0 SP
column10: as you’ve already spent it preparing the device. After the first time
column11: when you cast a spell using this feature
column12: roll 1d20 and gain the same effects from the table (potentially reducing the spell’s SPC). You always spend AP and follow conjuring rules as normal. These prepared Spell Devices do not trigger backlash the first time you would trigger backlash. If they trigger backlash a second time
column13: you lose access to the spell."

column7: "You create a permanent spell device that fires cantrips. Choose Beam of Fire
column8: Frostbite
column9: or Grave Whisper. This device cannot trigger backlash. You may now use your total Character Level for this cantrip’s power instead of your Arcane Power."

column6: "Your Golem gains a compartment that functions as a Dimensional Case (see the Tinkering Item table). This and items inside are shielded from Divining magic. It takes a creature a DC 20 AWR check to find the compartment and a DC 20 STR/Applied Force or INT/Lockpicking check to enter against the Golem’s will."
"You can create a second Spell Storing object."
"When you use your Magitechnician talent after Taking a Rest
column7: the first time you roll a 1 or 2 on your d20 rolls
column8: you may reroll that d20 and use the second result."

column6: "Your Spell Devices created by the Magitechnician talent can no longer trigger Backlash."
"Your Spell Devices created by the Magitechnician talent are no longer considered magical."
"When you deal damage with your Cantrip Cannon
column7: add your INT to the damage."

column6: "When one of your mental defenses is attacked
column7: you can spend 5 SP to add ½ your INT to all of your mental defenses until the beginning of your next turn."

column4: Tinkerer, Magitechnician,  Capstone, Flash of Genius
column6: "You master the art of arcane tinkering
column7: bending the rules of where magic ends and machinery begins. You gain a special permanent Spell Device with a spell that costs 10 SP or fewer. That spell permanently has SPC 0 for you."

column4: Gain another special permanent Spell Device with a spell that costs 16 SP or fewer. That spell permanently has SPC 0 for you.
